alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson; Central Greenville; Cherokee; Laurens; Northern Spartanburg; Southern Greenville; Southern Spartanburg; Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 6:01AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Polk, Laurens, southeastern Greenville, Spartanburg, east central Anderson, western Cherokee, northeastern Abbeville and northwestern Union Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 600 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Spartanburg to 13 miles east of Greenville Downtown to 11 miles north of Abbeville. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Gaffney, Laurens, Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville and Clinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Abbeville; Anderson; Central Greenville; Cherokee; Laurens; Northern Spartanburg; Southern Greenville; Southern Spartanburg; Union
